tweets.html:
Almost as fun as all the new fall TV shows— the moment you realize you can stop watching most of the new fall TV shows.

— Willa Paskin (@willapaskin) October 4, 2011

As charges of tone-deaf racism swirl around Rick Perry, Michael Patrick King scrambles to book him for a guest shot on #2BrokeGirls

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) October 4, 2011

"Up All Night" picked up for the full season = touchdown. "Whitney" picked up for the full season = illegal block in the back.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) October 4, 2011

NBC's Playboy Club wasn't offensive to anyone except fans of good television.

— Ben Grossman (@grossman) October 4, 2011

Farewell, "The Playboy Club." You just got "Rock Centered!"

— Rick Porter (@rickporter) October 4, 2011

NBC cancels THE PLAYBOY CLUB, proving the power of protesting TV shows. Or, um, not watching them.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) October 4, 2011

I know it's fun to mock cancelled shows, but no matter what you thought of Playboy Club, remember a lot of people lost their jobs today.

— Michael Markowitz (@markowitz) October 4, 2011

Less happy that Playboy Club got canceled after realizing that three of the main actors are out of the closet. I like supporting the brave.

— Loquaciousmuse (@loquaciousmuse) October 4, 2011

Unfortunately, the show just plain sucked. Sigh.

— Loquaciousmuse (@loquaciousmuse) October 4, 2011

The Playboy Club is cancelled. Too bad. Although I only watched it for the ads.

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) October 4, 2011

As embarrassing names go, "Cougartown" and "The Good Wife" have nothing on "The Playboy Club." Who would say they watch that show?

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) October 4, 2011

NBC to "Playboy Club" actors: "You can start shaving your pubes, again."

— Danny Zuker (@DannyZuker) October 4, 2011

Displaced "Playboy Club" fans, try out our hot drama "W.H.O.R.E." -- Tuesdays at 9/8c on #UPN! It also makes @ThePTC weep.

— UPN (@upntweets) October 4, 2011

PTC got Playboy Club canceled about as much as I got Apple not to release an iPhone 5 so my iPhone 4 would still be cool #theshowjustsucked

— Ben Grossman (@grossman) October 4, 2011

Wish someone would just produce a combo Firefly/Arrested Development tv show...make the internet shut up already. #MalintheMiddleoftheBluths

— Will Dixon (@wcdixon) October 4, 2011

I'm watching the new NBC show Whitney. She was a lot funnier when she and Bobby Brown had their own reality show.

— Suzy Soro (@HotComesToDie) October 4, 2011

The only problem with Whitney's new show is the laugh track. It's so loud you can't hear what the actors are saying. Thank God.

— Suzy Soro (@HotComesToDie) October 4, 2011

#Whitney gets full season order, I hope deal is to hire better writers and supporting cast. Worst.Supporting.Cast.On.TV.

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) October 4, 2011

Remember #Whitney fan (s?) , #Outsourced also got a full season pick up last year. #HopeInHumanity

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) October 4, 2011

NBC, stop trying to make Whitney happen. It's not going to happen.

— Christina Arango Dowling (@fatherdowling) October 4, 2011

Now, that RAGE is finally out, can people who've played it tell me if there's a Gale Bedeker mod?

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) October 4, 2011

Lag in iPhone news is smokescreen for NBC to dump more of its crappy shows, hoping we don't notice.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) October 4, 2011

My Twitter feed is implying Suri Cruise will be standard on all future iPhones. Which kinda makes sense.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) October 4, 2011

Apple announces iWhedon and then cancels it.

— Simon (@simonuk) October 4, 2011

The voice recognition system in the new iPhone seems a lot like having a secretary. That thing is gonna get sexually harassed so much.

— A.S. Paul (@aspaul) October 4, 2011

@aspaul I plan to call mine "Joan."

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) October 4, 2011

I just asked Siri what shows will be canceled next. She said, "A whole shitload of them. Next week's a bloodbath." I love it already, Apple!

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) October 4, 2011

NBC announces that they will pick up THIS CHRIS CHRISTIE PRESS CONFERENCE THAT IS HAPPENING NOW for a second season.

— Jason Linkins (@dceiver) October 4, 2011

Don’t worry, none of our tweets will spoil the plot of The #Muppets. It’s already gone bad. Oh ho ho ho!

— The Muppets (@TheMuppets) October 4, 2011

Problem with no longer being in a writers' room: strangers on street far less likely to laugh at my masturbation jokes.

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) October 4, 2011

My plan to save US economy: cancel "Whitney" & redirect the NBC ad budget to pay off debt

— Ari Berman (@AriBerman) October 4, 2011

Do you think they told Jimmy Fallon they would play his more cash commercials 483,437 times -- until everyone hated him?

— Joe Posnanski (@JPosnanski) October 4, 2011

Wait, a Dancing With the Stars pro has enough haters to be on H8R? Or are they just picking names out of a hat now?

— Maggie Furlong (@MaggieFurlong) October 4, 2011

Yahoo: "Fall's best new show sparks controversy." Best new show = American Horror Story. I guess they forgot to ask ever TV critic I know.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) October 5, 2011

Me during entire #AmericanHorrorStory pilot: "Oh, no, Mrs. Coach. OH NO."

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) October 5, 2011

I'm a horror fan, but AMERICAN HORROR STORY sounds like GLEE GOES TO THE OVERLOOK. Camp, like sarcasm, is bracing at 1st, then tiresome.

— Adam Barken (@adambarken) October 5, 2011

Just watched JR's and Karina's homage to soldiers who don't come home. Fine arts should NEVER be the first thing cut from schools. #DWTS

— Kelli Marshall (@KelliMarshall) October 5, 2011

With all due respect to Fox & "The Simpsons" voice cast: Bicker at your peril. Very few people will care now if the series ends.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) October 4, 2011

If Fox needs more money to keep "The Simpsons" up and running, they should use some of the 9 billion dollars they made from "The Simpsons."

— Ken Tremendous (@KenTremendous) October 5, 2011

Rank in order from worst to I'll take that last one: Oscar movie Crash; song "Crash Into Me" by Dave Matthews Band; actual violent crash.

— Michael Neal (@slapclap) October 5, 2011

I've solved television comedy: Jess from New Girl is the perfect woman for Tom Haverford, at least judging by the first 2 minutes of this ep

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) October 5, 2011

If the guys on NEW GIRL threw out Jess and moved in Max from 2 BROKE GIRLS, I would watch that.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) October 5, 2011

#TheNewGirl makes me re-evaluate my best-friendships. we never burst into perfectly sync'd & choreo'd songs in our first weeks as friends.

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) October 5, 2011

tweets.author_name: heather "if u spoil Last Jedi ur dead to me" mason
tweets.html:
Biggest Loser makes me simultaneously feel good about myself AND that that 2nd brownie is the beginning of my downward spiral.

— heather "if u spoil Last Jedi ur dead to me" mason (@NerdHeather) October 5, 2011

Torn between discussing the incredibly cheap nature of the new full Dawson's Creek box set and denying I own it.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) October 5, 2011

The person who came up with the new Arby's slogan/campaign is the anti-Don Draper.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) October 5, 2011

Watching Prohibition and thinking it would be funny if they'd interviewed the historians Drunk History style.

— Elysse Applebaum (@yapplebee) October 5, 2011

I can't decide which character's storyline is worse. They are all so terrible. #90210

— tv observatory (@tvobservatory) October 5, 2011

Like Dixon's is really bad. But then Naomi's is really bad. But then Navid's is really bad.

— tv observatory (@tvobservatory) October 5, 2011

The music at the beginning of #Ringer today added nothing to the scene and is the perfect example of how The CW ruins everything.

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) October 5, 2011

Ioan Grufffuddddd is so handsome.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 5, 2011

That's the entirety of my Ringer recap, by the way.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 5, 2011

Hey, something happened! #Ringer

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 5, 2011

I don't believe this. At all. RT @TVandDinners: Hey, something happened! #Ringer

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) October 5, 2011

Loved Hart of Dixie but if Scott Porter doesn't take his shirt off soon i'm having a word with @JoshSchwartz76 and folk

— Kevin Williamson (@kevwilliamson) October 5, 2011

It's 96 degrees in BlueBell -- why would he wear a shirt? It's not logical. It was clearly a hole in the plot.

— Kevin Williamson (@kevwilliamson) October 5, 2011

Plot pitch. Lemon is attacked by Burt Reynolds and George rips his shirt off to apply direct pressure to stop the bleeding.

— Kevin Williamson (@kevwilliamson) October 5, 2011

Pitch 2: Zoe goes four wheeling and gets muddy so George rips his shirt off to wipe away her mud.

— Kevin Williamson (@kevwilliamson) October 5, 2011

No.3: They all go to the swimming hole and George rips off his shirt and dives in first to scare away the snakes.

— Kevin Williamson (@kevwilliamson) October 5, 2011

In a tender character moment, George helps the needy and gives the shirt off his back.

— Kevin Williamson (@kevwilliamson) October 5, 2011

I admire and respect @kevwilliamson's commitment to getting Scott Porter to take off his shirt. You're doing the Lord's work, sir.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 5, 2011

I just yelled at a person on Wheel of Fortune for choosing a letter that had no chance of being on the board. Does that make me crotchety?

— Nick Campbell (@sononick) October 5, 2011

Proposed Parenthood spinoff: Bonnie Bedelia Fills Her Day.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) October 5, 2011

@tvoti Will that air before or after "Erika Christensen Has a Husband" and "Joy Bryant Is Too Hot To Write Out Entirely"?

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) October 5, 2011

Another Parenthood spinoff: Craig T. Nelson, Gentleman Actor

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) October 5, 2011

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
@HitFixDaniel @tvoti Also, "Haddie Gets Her Groove Back."

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) October 5, 2011

@HitFixDaniel @sarCCastro @tvoti Also: "Michael B. Jordan, Honorable Young Man."

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) October 5, 2011

One Braverman dancing is better than most hours of TV. #Parenthood #FTW #Sniff

— Lesley Goldberg (@Snoodit) October 5, 2011

I enjoy writing about Parenthood more than just about any other show. I think it appreciates my gentle mockery and accepts my hugs.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) October 5, 2011

Oh #Parenthood, you can do no wrong.

— Philiana (@insidethetube) October 5, 2011

What do you mean Entourage ended when I was on my road trip?! How did they manage to wrap up so many complex characters?

— Jack Burditt (@jackburditt) October 5, 2011

So.Many.Inappropriate.Outfits.On.This.Show. #Glee

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) October 5, 2011

I've always loved Mike Chang. This scene...his dancing...his face...can I get pregnant from this?

— Brokenhearted Gleek. (@AwkwardGLEE) October 5, 2011

Mike Chang you magnificent bastard.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) October 5, 2011

I could watch Harry Shum do things on my television all the time. #Glee

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 5, 2011

God dammit, Ian Brennan.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) October 5, 2011

Please stop saying "Booty Camp." #Glee

— Kelli Marshall (@KelliMarshall) October 5, 2011

Dot Marie Jones, consistently rising above crappy writing and making me laugh at awful, offensive things. #Glee

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 5, 2011

Angry Will Schuester is the best. Or maybe the worst. OK, probably the worst.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) October 5, 2011

As per usual, the highs and lows are very close together on #Glee.

— mesk (@_mesk) October 5, 2011

SOMETIMES FALSETTO IS BAD YOU GUYS. #Glee #Kurtfail

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 5, 2011

please.don't.sing..please don't sing...please don't sing.... oh shit. ...#Glee

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) October 5, 2011

#Glee make me sort of cry twice, which means I should probably call my health insurance company and check my mental health benefits.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 5, 2011

"It's not about doing your best anymore, it's about doing better" #glee #huh?

— kevinbiegel (@kbiegel) October 5, 2011

The only show Rachel Berry should be spun off into is 'I Hate My Teenage Daughter.' #Glee

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) October 5, 2011

Try as "Glee" might, it could not fuck up "Fix You," at least not to the point where I'm not having embarrassing reactions to it.

— Joe Reid (@joereid) October 5, 2011

My greatest GLEE spin-off wish: Mike Chang and Brittany as struggling dancers in New York City. Blaine can come too. #glee

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) October 5, 2011

Might be time for that AT&T couple -- the guy with the free minutes and his greenhouse wife -- to see a marriage counselor.

— Joe Posnanski (@JPosnanski) October 5, 2011

If I keep watching these Breaking Bad episodes, one of them MUST end with everyone learning a lesson and hugging and laughing.

— John Moe (@johnmoe) October 5, 2011

I think the prod. budget for the 5-Hour Energy Commercials was $5.49, $3.49 of which went towards the purchase of a bottle of 5-Hour Energy.

— Drew Morton (@thecinemadoctor) October 5, 2011

Hey kids, please watch Free Agents this wednesday at 8:30. I fear it may be your last chance!!

— Hank Azaria (@HankAzaria) October 4, 2011

How did Hayden Panettiere not win 13 Emmys for this Amanda Knox movie I'm half-watching on mute?

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) October 5, 2011

Sigh. The absence of an Emmy for this Amanda Knox movie leaves Panettiere frustratingly E-G-O-T short of EGOT.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) October 5, 2011

The fact that the "booty text" has replaced the "booty call" has created some oddly specific story problems.

— Sarah Watson (@SarahWatson42) October 5, 2011

I hope "Rock Center" fails as a newsmagazine & gets reborn as a primetime concert stage for emerging alternative bands.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) October 5, 2011

A.C. Nielsen, Jr., who led the Nielsen Ratings Service, passed away yesterday, at the age of "over 54".

— Tim Carvell (@timcarvell) October 5, 2011
